description: From Middle French alkermès, probably from Spanish alquermes, from Arabic الْقِرْمِز‎ (al-qirmiz), from Persian کرمست‎ (kermest), from Middle Persian, from Sanskrit [Term?].

entries.meaning: The desiccated bodies of certain insects (female Kermes ilicis and Kermes vermilio), which live on the kermes oak, formerly much used as a material for dye and a medicinal ingredient; also a given mixture, preparation etc. containing such insects.
